author: Staff Reporter
text:
AIMTC threatens to go on an indefinite strike

Newly elected office-bearers of State Lorry Owners’ Federation – Tamil Nadu along with All India Motor Transport Congress president (centre) Bhim Wadhwa in Namakkal on Saturday.- PHOTO: E. LAKSHMI NARAYANAN

All India Motor Transport Congress (AIMTC) Toll Committee chairman G.R. Shanmugappa has warned that if the Central Government failed to scrap the existing toll system, they would be forced to conduct a nation-wide strike. A decision on this would be taken at the general body meeting to be held at Hassan in Karnataka on January 30 and 31, he said.

Addressing the media during the installation of office-bearers for the State Lorry Owners’ Federation – Tamil Nadu for 2015-18, he said that at the end of the nation-wide lorry strike in October 2015, the Centre had assured that announcements on scrapping the toll system and implementing one-time payment of taxes would be made by December 15, 2015 . “But no announcements were made so far,” he said.

He warned that AIMTC would decide on an indefinite strike if their demands were not met.

Mr. Shanmugappa said that the Centre has cancelled the eligibility norm of mandatory pass in Class 8 for obtaining heavy motor vehicle licence and wanted the State government to follow the same norm.

AIMTC president Bhim Wadhwa expressed hope that the toll gates would be removed soon across the country. State Minister for Industries and Transport P. Thangamani said that various demands of the associations would be brought to the notice of the government.

New office-bearers

R. Kumarasamy took oath as president, C. Dhanraj as secretary and P. Sirangan as treasurer of the State Lorry Owners’ Federation – Tamil Nadu for 2015-18. .
title: Call to scrap existing toll system
